alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 2:57PM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MONDAY TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 in the lower elevations and 12 to 20 inches over Marias Pass and in the higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Polebridge, Marias Pass, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, and Essex. * WHEN...From 11 PM Monday to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
